file_content.text: Hmph. Reminds me of old times.
Here's my weapon--consider me surrendered. I'll make my way up to the Senate tower and turn myself in. See what Garza wants to do next.
I'm glad to have you back on our side.
You've made the right choice.
I never said I was on your side, soldier. I'm doing this for my people, not for your Republic or anything else.
That's a long trip, old man. Time's wasting.
Better get moving, then.
Ah, these kids today....
I'll be watching you, Kardan.
Just be sure you behave.
Feel free. Maybe you'll learn something.
Anyhow, I'm sure we'll meet again.
I'm glad I had a chance to fight with you, sir.
It's been an honor.
Yeah, I guess it was nice to finally stretch my legs out a bit.
There's a relay down here that needs to be detonated.
I have some work to do first.
Yeah, I suppose you've got a job to do. So much work down here for nothing....
Bringing you in alive better not have been a waste of my time.
Hope you're worth the trouble.
And you'd better not have been feeding me a load of garbage.
See you topside, soldier.
Let's go take out that relay and give Kardan's little babies something to think about.
Let's get 'em!
Hmph. Still alive, huh? You really should've gotten out of this while you were ahead, soldier.
Now, you're a risk to Tavus and the rest of my people. So, Havoc Squad or not, I'm going to have to kill you.
You always have a choice, sir.
You don't have to do anything.
If you cared about Tavus and the others, you wouldn't have let them defect.
Don't give me that.
I've made my choice. Tavus, Wraith, Needles, Gearbox, Fuse... they're like my children. And I abandoned them. I resigned and left them to fight alone, just to make a point.
They need my help now more than ever. I'm not going to abandon them. Not this time.
If you want to help your people, you'll help me bring them in alive.
This doesn't help them.
What, so Garza can have all their heads and be done with it? I don't think so.
The Imperials are the enemy. You aren't one of them!
But you're helping the Empire!
The Republic came just as close to killing me as the Empire ever did. Far as I'm concerned, everyone's my enemy.
I know you're trying to get into my head, soldier, but it's not going to work.
I'm just talking, sir--one soldier to another.
I'm not manipulating you.
What do we have to talk about? Our objectives are completely at odds.
Think what you want, Kardan. Doesn't make my point any less true.
You know I'm right.
All I know is that you're really trying my patience, soldier. I don't even understand what you're trying to convince me of, here.
I'm trying to keep my people alive, and it's your mission to kill them. That's all there is to this, soldier.
I served with your people, sir. I don't want to kill them.
There's more to this.
Well, you've certainly taken your time trying to kill me.
General Garza sent me to get your help. She wants to bring your people in alive.
Garza wants them alive.
Not sure if I buy that. But then again, if she sent you to kill me, we wouldn't still be talking, would we?
The only way to keep your people alive is if you help me bring them in.
Cooperate and they might live.
Hmm... you've already compromised the relay. Even if we take you out, it's only a matter of time until Garza has this place slagged for a klick in every direction.
And by now, Garza will know exactly where all of the defector bases are. They'll be tethered banthas, cut off from each other and all--
Excuse me, sir, but shouldn't we be--
The Imperials might offer help, but it won't be much. They'll all be left to die.
Tavus and the others will follow your lead. If you come in peacefully, they will, too.
You can make the difference.
They'll just get themselves killed if you don't help me, can't you see that?
Now do you understand?
It's useless to resist, Kardan.
I think you get the idea.
Damn... I can't believe it's come to this.
Sir?
All right, soldier. I'll go along with this. But if you harm a single one of my people, you will be dead within the day. Understood?
You have my word on it, Kardan.
Understood, sir.
If your people won't come peacefully, they'll still have to be dealt with.
I may have no choice.
And if you kill one of them, you'll be dead within the day. That's a promise.
I'm not afraid of you, old man.
You don't scare me.
You don't have to be afraid of me to be killed by me. So consider yourself warned.
Let's get on with this, soldier.
I can't allow you to go into enemy custody alive, Kardan.
Are you still here? The op's over, people. Finished. Mission failed. So get out of here, while you've still got the legs to carry you.
You leave me no choice, sir. Ready your weapons, men!
If words won't work, let's try action.
Good--I'm tired of talking.
Hope you've had a good life, you old fool.
Then you die.
Let's see what you're made of, soldier.
Let's see what you're made of, traitor.
Bring it on.
Call me "traitor" all you want, soldier. It's the last thing you'll ever do.
You listen to me, Kardan. Helping you has already put my operation at risk. You will do exactly as I say, when I say, or--
Or you'll what, Captain? I'm not one of your lock-stepping drones--this part of the op is mine. End of discussion.
How dare you--
Intruders!
Put those blasters on the floor, soldiers. Nice and slow.
Intruder!
Drop that weapon, soldier. You're outnumbered and outgunned.
In the name of the Republic, I order you to surrender.
Give it up, Kardan.
Imperial soldiers. So you are a traitor, just like Tavus and the others.
Nice friends you have here.
You're going to pay for what you've done, Kardan. You, Tavus--everyone.
It's not betrayal if you aren't on their side in the first place, soldier. Now put that weapon down or--
Unless you want to die, you should follow your own advice.
Don't be stupid.
It's over, Kardan. You, the Imps, Tavus--you're all going down.
Not going to happen, soldier. Now drop that weapon before--
A Havoc badge? Is this a joke? No, no--you must be the new recruit Tavus told me about. So you survived after all.
Can't say I'm surprised, honestly. Havoc always did recruit the best.
Surrender, and this will all go much easier for you.
Don't make this any harder.
I'm not interested in compliments from a traitor.
Save your praise.
It's not treason when the Republic betrays you first; it's self-preservation.
This is your last chance.
You are persistent, soldier. I'll give you that.
I'm impressed--I didn't think the old lady would send someone after me so quickly. After all these years, Garza still hasn't lost her edge.
What are you waiting for, Kardan? Kill the whelp! Or do you lack the true resolve to fight for the Empire?
My loyalty is to Tavus. Not to your Empire, and not to anyone else.
You want the trooper dead, you take care of it. I don't kill good soldiers. I'm heading down to the Works to make sure everything is prepped.
You won't escape me for long, Kardan.
This isn't over.
Not so fast!
Your days are numbered.
Do yourself a favor and die now, soldier--before you get in any deeper over your head.
Open fire, men!
We're Havoc Squad, maggot--and you just signed your own death warrant.
